User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the VES RideShare application.

SharingRoom.title: SharingRoom
SharingRoom.description: Represents a ride-sharing room created by a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the sharing room.

ownerId.description: Reference to the User who created the room. (Relationship: User 1:N SharingRoom)

ownerName.description: The name of the user who owns the room. Denormalized for read-efficiency.

ownerAvatarUrl.description: The avatar URL of the user who owns the room. Denormalized for read-efficiency.

autoStatus.description: Indicates whether the auto (vehicle) has been found for the sharing.

destination.description: The destination for the ride sharing.

startingPoint.description: The starting point for the ride sharing.

expirationTime.description: The date and time when the sharing room expires.

participantIds.description: References to Users who are participating in the room. (Relationship: User N:N SharingRoom)

definition.description: Stores user profiles. Access is restricted to the authenticated user (path-based ownership).

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier of the user.

definition.description: Stores ride-sharing room information. Includes denormalized 'ownerId' for authorization independence.

params.name: sharingRoomId

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to support the VES RideShare application, focusing on user authentication, sharing room management, and smart matching of users for ride-sharing. Authorization Independence is achieved by storing the `ownerId` within each `SharingRoom` document. This avoids the need for `get()` calls in security rules to verify ownership, enabling atomic operations. Structural Segregation is applied by storing user data in a private collection (`/users/{userId}`), while sharing rooms are stored in a separate collection (`/sharingRooms/{sharingRoomId}`), allowing for distinct security rules for each.

The structure supports required QAPs (Queries and Permissions) as follows:

*   **List Sharing Rooms:** Listing is supported on the `/sharingRooms` collection.
*   **Authorization:** Access to a sharing room will be granted to any authenticated user.
*   **User Data Privacy:**  User documents are private, accessible only to the authenticated user.
